meanings.definition: To be under obligation to pay or repay (money or something else) to someone in return for something received.
meanings.sent1: I owed my friend five dollars for the movie ticket.
meanings.sent2: She owed a thank you to her teacher for helping her with the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat owed the dog a favor for sharing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The student owed his success to his hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The company owed its growth to the support of its loyal customers.

meanings.definition: To be due or owing as a debt, right, or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The bill owed by the end of the month was for the electricity.
meanings.sent2: He owed a sincere apology to his friend for forgetting her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The tree owed its beauty to the care it received from the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The team owed their victory to their teamwork and strategy.
meanings.sent5: The artist owed her inspiration to the colorful sunset she witnessed.
